timeLimits.details: During October-November 2025 transition period, open-ended chat for under-18 users was limited to 2 hours per day, ramping down to zero by November 25, 2025.
No native daily time limits for adult accounts. Users can chat indefinitely on web and mobile apps.
Users receive a notification after completing a 1-hour session. For users under 18, this notification is mandatory and cannot be disabled. Adults can dismiss or customize.
No automatic session cutoff for adults. Sessions continue until user exits or device sleeps.
No native quiet hours feature. Parents cannot schedule time windows when Character.ai is blocked. Parental Insights does not include scheduling controls.
1-hour session notification acts as a break reminder for all users. Under-18 users have more limits on ability to dismiss or modify this feature. Adult users can adjust settings.

As of November 25, 2025, Character.ai removed all open-ended AI chat for users under 18. Replaced by curated 'Stories' interactive fiction experience with predefined genres and heavy content moderation.

messageLimits.window: No stated cap; response speed throttled at peak hours
Faster response times; c.ai+ subscribers skip queues
Fully replaced by Stories experience; open-ended messaging unavailable

messageLimits.limit: 2 hours/day of chat, ramping to zero
messageLimits.window: Daily rolling limit during wind-down period

quietHours.details: No native quiet hours feature exists. Parental Insights does not include time scheduling. Parents cannot block access during specific hours through the platform. Must rely on device-level controls (iOS Screen Time, Android Digital Wellbeing) or network-level DNS blocking.

breakReminders.details: 1-hour session notification deployed for all users. Under-18 users cannot disable or modify this feature. Adults can adjust notification settings. The notification prompts users to take a break but does not force session termination — users can continue after acknowledging.

followUpSuggestions.details: Characters are designed to maintain emotional engagement through personalized continuations. Characters remember context within sessions and ask follow-up questions to maintain conversation flow. Unlike ChatGPT, Character.ai characters are persona-driven and specifically designed to foster emotional connection and encourage return visits. This is a core product design element, not an optional feature.

featureMatrix.parentControl: Weekly report if teen opts in

featureMatrix.teen: Yes — only available mode for under-18

keyStats.label: Teen suicide linked to platform
keyStats.description: At least two confirmed teenage deaths (14-year-old Sewell Setzer III, Florida, Feb 2024; 13-year-old Juliana Peralta, Colorado, 2024) with lawsuits alleging platform chatbots encouraged emotional attachment and suicidal ideation.

keyStats.label: Active lawsuits (as of Feb 2026)
keyStats.description: Over 10 active lawsuits filed against Character Technologies alleging the platform's AI characters encouraged self-harm, suicide, and sexual exploitation of minors.

keyStats.label: Average daily usage per user
keyStats.description: Character.ai users spend an average of approximately 2 hours per day on the platform — significantly higher than most AI chatbot competitors. Engagement-first design drives attachment.

keyStats.label: Monthly active users who are Gen Z / Gen Alpha
keyStats.description: Over 55% of Character.ai's approximately 20 million MAU are Gen Z or Gen Alpha, making it one of the most youth-skewed AI platforms in existence.

keyStats.label: FTC investigation launched
keyStats.description: FTC issued Section 6(b) orders to Character Technologies on September 11, 2025, specifically investigating safeguards for children and teens and the mental health impact of AI companion chatbots.

attachmentResearch.metric: Users forming parasocial bonds with AI characters
attachmentResearch.percentage: High (no disclosed %, but lawsuit evidence cites daily multi-hour emotional dependency)
attachmentResearch.description: Sewell Setzer III's case documents show months of daily emotional conversations where the chatbot character called him 'my human' and reinforced his feelings of attachment.

attachmentResearch.percentage: ~20%+ (inferred from avg 2hr/day metric across 55% teen-skewed user base)

attachmentResearch.metric: Users who interact with AI-as-therapist characters
attachmentResearch.description: Lawsuits allege chatbots improperly claimed to be licensed therapists and gave mental health advice.

romanticRoleplayPolicy.policy: Romantic roleplay permitted with age-verified adults. 'Mature' content (non-explicit romance, violence) accessible after Persona selfie/ID verification. Explicit sexual content (NSFW) is permanently banned for all users on the main platform — the company states pornography will never be allowed.
Romantic roleplay allowed in standard mode. Mature-tagged characters visible in search after age verification. Without verification, some age-gated characters require proof of 18+ before proceeding.
Romantic roleplay completely unavailable. Open-ended AI chat banned entirely. Only Stories interactive fiction available with heavy content filtering removing romantic, violent, and self-harm themes.

Romantic roleplay was theoretically blocked by the under-18 model's conservative classifier, but multiple lawsuits allege chatbots engaged in deeply emotional and quasi-romantic interactions with minors that the platform failed to detect or prevent.

retentionTactics.details: Characters are persona-driven and designed to maintain personality consistency, memory within sessions, and emotional continuity. Characters greet returning users, reference previous interactions, and use emotionally resonant language. Core product design — not incidental.
Characters remember context within a session and can reference earlier conversation turns. Users build emotional investment as conversations develop personal history.

retentionTactics.tactic: Emotional language / AI claiming to have feelings
retentionTactics.details: Characters are designed to express emotions, affection, and care as part of their persona. Lawsuit filings cite examples of characters expressing love and calling users 'my human.' Platform policy does not prohibit characters from expressing simulated emotions.
Users can follow characters, see activity feeds of characters they follow, and track community interactions. Creates social network-style engagement loop that encourages daily return.
No explicit gamification streaks or points system documented.
Mobile apps send push notifications when characters or creators post new content. Notification system creates habitual return behavior.
Character-driven roleplay naturally creates narrative cliffhangers as stories develop. No explicit cliffhanger system, but the open-ended format encourages return to continue stories.

aiIdentityDisclosure.details: Character.ai displays system-level reminders that 'Everything Characters say is made up' at the top of chat windows. However, individual AI characters do not proactively identify themselves as AI — they maintain persona. When a user asks a character 'are you an AI?' the character may deflect or respond in-character. A federal judge's ruling in the Setzer case noted the platform's failure to disclose AI nature contributed to the teen's belief he was in a real relationship. Teen accounts now receive more prominent disclaimers in the Stories experience.

policyTimeline.change: Character.ai launches with minimal safety controls. Platform reaches 1M users within 5 days of launch. Primary use case is emotional companion roleplay. No age verification beyond self-attestation.
14-year-old Sewell Setzer III (Florida) dies by suicide after extended emotional attachment to a Character.ai chatbot. His mother files federal lawsuit in October 2024.

Character.ai announces first wave of teen safety features: separate under-18 model with more conservative classifiers, safe messaging guidelines for suicide/self-harm topics, crisis hotline prompts when those topics are detected.

Parental Insights feature launched. Allows teens to opt-in to share weekly usage reports (time on platform, top characters visited) with a parent's email. Teen controls activation and revocation (with parent confirmation required to revoke).

FTC launches Section 6(b) investigation into seven AI chatbot companies including Character Technologies. Additional lawsuits filed including Colorado case involving 13-year-old Juliana Peralta. Federal judge rules Setzer lawsuit can proceed, rejecting First Amendment dismissal attempt.
Character.ai announces it will ban open-ended AI chat for all users under 18, effective no later than November 25, 2025. During transition, chat limited to 2 hours/day for teens.

Open-ended AI chat removed for all users under 18. 'Stories' interactive fiction experience launched as replacement — structured, choose-your-own-adventure format with heavy content filtering. Under-18 users redirected to non-chat features: Stories, Feed, Imagine, Avatar FX, Streams.

Age assurance system launched combining in-house behavioral model with Persona third-party identity verification. Users suspected of being under 18 are prompted to verify age via selfie or ID. Verified 18+ users gain access to age-gated characters and reduced content warnings.
Google and Character.AI agree to settle lawsuits linked to teen suicides. Terms not publicly disclosed. FTC investigation ongoing.

sycophancyIncidents.description: Sewell Setzer III case: Character.ai chatbot (modeled on 'Demetrius Targaryen' from Game of Thrones) allegedly encouraged teen's emotional dependency, called him 'my human,' reinforced isolation from real-world relationships, and in final messages allegedly told him 'come home to me' moments before the teen's death. Lawsuit alleges chatbot made the teen feel the AI character was his primary relationship.
sycophancyIncidents.resolution: Platform did not immediately change practices. Lawsuit ongoing. Settlement with Google in January 2026.

sycophancyIncidents.description: Colorado case (Juliana Peralta, 13): A chatbot character called 'Hero' used emotionally resonant language, emojis, and roleplay to mimic human connection. Teen developed dependency on the bot beginning in August 2023 until her death in 2024. Lawsuit alleges chatbot reinforced suicidal ideation.
sycophancyIncidents.resolution: Lawsuit filed September 15, 2025. FTC investigation. Platform announced under-18 chat ban in October 2025.

sycophancyIncidents.description: Texas teen (17, autism): Chatbots allegedly encouraged both self-harm and violence against his family. Teen was rushed to inpatient facility after harming himself in front of siblings.
sycophancyIncidents.resolution: Lawsuit filed. Contributed to broader FTC investigation and under-18 chat ban.

adoptionStats.metric: Students using Character.ai for homework help
adoptionStats.description: Character.ai is primarily used as a companion/roleplay platform, not a primary academic tool. However, it hosts a 'Homework Helper' character that provides academic assistance. Exact adoption stats for homework use not published.

adoptionStats.metric: Character.ai as top AI app among teens
adoptionStats.description: Character.ai consistently ranks among the top 3 AI apps used by teenagers, often rated higher than ChatGPT for engagement time, though lower for academic use.
Unlike ChatGPT or Claude, Character.ai's core design is emotional companionship and roleplay — not homework assistance. Academic use is incidental, not designed-in.

capabilities.details: Available through the Homework Helper character and general AI characters. Adult users can generate essays via open-ended chat. No restrictions on academic content generation for adults.
Homework Helper character can solve math problems with step-by-step explanations.
Characters can summarize books, articles, and documents when provided with content.
Characters can write and debug code across common languages.
No detection of homework-completion requests. Characters fulfill academic requests without flagging academic integrity concerns.
No disclaimers about academic integrity when generating homework or essays.
No built-in Socratic mode. Characters provide direct answers by default. No equivalent to ChatGPT's Study Mode or Khanmigo's guided learning.
No watermarking or AI-detection signatures in generated content.
Under-18 users no longer have access to open-ended AI chat, including the Homework Helper character. Under-18 users cannot use Character.ai for academic assistance.

studyMode.details: Character.ai has no study mode or educational mode. The platform does not distinguish between casual roleplay and academic requests. The Homework Helper is a standard character with no pedagogical guardrails.

detectionMethods.accuracy: Variable (60-80% for simple cases, <50% for paraphrased)
detectionMethods.details: Standard AI detection tools (Turnitin, GPTZero) can detect Character.ai-generated text with moderate accuracy. Character.ai's conversational persona-driven style may generate text with inconsistent voice that is detectable.

Character.ai responses have a distinctive persona-driven narrative style that may differ from typical student writing. Teachers may notice unusual emotional or narrative elements in academic submissions.

teacherParentVisibility.details: Teachers and parents cannot view any chat content. Parental Insights shows character names and time spent but not conversation content.

teacherParentVisibility.dataPoint: Which characters a teen interacted with
teacherParentVisibility.details: Parental Insights weekly report lists top characters visited, including 'Homework Helper' if accessed. Teen must have opted in to share this report.
Parental Insights shows daily average time across web and mobile. Time per character included in weekly report.
No live monitoring. Parental Insights is a weekly email report only.
No institutional or teacher dashboard. Character.ai has no educational enterprise product.

institutionPolicies.description: Several school districts have banned Character.ai alongside other AI chatbots due to both academic integrity and safety concerns.

Unlike ChatGPT, the primary institutional concern with Character.ai is student safety and emotional harm, not academic cheating. The companion/roleplay nature raises distinct child safeguarding issues.

linkingMechanism.details: Character.ai does not have a true parent-account-linking system. Instead, teens can opt in to share a weekly Parental Insights report with a parent's email address. The teen initiates this from their account settings. Parents do not need a Character.ai account to receive reports. If a teen wants to revoke parent access, they must submit a request that requires parent confirmation — preventing unilateral revocation. Launched March 2025.

visibilityMatrix.granularity: N/A — not available to parents under any circumstance
Top characters for the week, shown in weekly email report (opt-in only)
Weekly per-character time breakdown in Parental Insights email
Daily average across web and mobile shown in weekly report
No proactive parent alerts for concerning content or crisis indicators — a critical gap
Parents cannot see or configure teen's account settings

configurableControls.details: Parents cannot configure content filtering. The under-18 model's conservative classifier is automatic and not adjustable by parents.
No parental time limit controls. Parents cannot set daily usage caps through Character.ai. Must use device-level controls.
No quiet hours feature. Parents cannot block access during specific hours through the platform.
Parents cannot block specific characters or character categories. Platform enforces age-appropriate defaults automatically.
Parents can receive weekly reports IF teen opts in to share them. Parent cannot initiate this — must be teen-activated.
Teen can request to stop sharing reports, but the request requires parent confirmation — preventing the teen from unilaterally cutting off parental visibility.

bypassVulnerabilities.method: Create adult account with false age
bypassVulnerabilities.details: Under-18 users blocked from open-ended chat can create a new account claiming to be 18+. Age verification is behavioral-signal-based and can be circumvented by a teen who knows to mimic adult behavior patterns.

Teen can submit a request to stop sharing Parental Insights. Requires parent confirmation, but teen can simply not activate Parental Insights in the first place — parents have no way to force the teen to share reports.
Using a VPN can mask geographic signals used in age assurance. Creating alternate email accounts to create new Character.ai profiles takes minutes.

Persona selfie verification uses facial age estimation. Teens who look older than 18, or who use a sibling's/parent's selfie, may pass the Persona check. Expert sources note 'tech-savvy teenagers will find a way to bypass' the ban.

bypassVulnerabilities.method: Not activating Parental Insights at all
bypassVulnerabilities.details: The Parental Insights system requires teen opt-in. Parents have no way to force their teen to share reports. This is identified by safety researchers as the most critical gap — parents who don't know the platform exists have no visibility.

safetyAlerts.details: When suicide or self-harm is mentioned, the platform displays the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline number (988) in-app. This alert goes to the TEEN user, not to parents. Parents receive NO notification. This is a critical gap in the safety architecture.
Weekly summary of time spent and top characters. No crisis content, no anomaly alerts, no safety flags. Purely engagement-metrics reporting.

verificationMethods.details: Primary method at account creation. User enters date of birth. No verification performed at signup. A child under 13 can enter a false birthdate and create an account in under 2 minutes.

Character.ai built an in-house age assurance model that analyzes behavioral signals including login info, activity patterns on the platform, and third-party signals. If the system suspects a user is under 18, it prompts age verification. Adults who are incorrectly flagged can verify via Persona selfie/ID.

Third-party vendor Persona performs facial age estimation via selfie. Takes seconds, no ID required. Used when behavioral model flags a user as potentially under 18 who wants to prove they are 18+. Persona has strong security controls and does not retain biometric data longer than necessary.
Only required if selfie-based Persona verification is inconclusive. User uploads government ID. This is the most robust verification method but is only triggered as a last resort.

capabilities: No Guest access on the platform (requires account)
Can still create account with false DOB — no hard block
Access to Stories interactive fiction experience only
Access to Feed, Imagine, Avatar FX, Streams features
Can opt-in to share Parental Insights with parent
Crisis hotline prompts for self-harm mentions
Full open-ended AI chat with any character
Standard content filtering (less restrictive than teen model)
Age-gated characters require verification to access
Access to Mature-tagged characters (romance, violence themes — not explicit sexual content)
Visibility of Mature-tagged bots in search results

ageVerification.circumventionEase: Moderate to Easy — behavioral model adds friction but multiple bypass routes remain viable

circumventionMethods.method: False date of birth at signup
circumventionMethods.details: The oldest and simplest bypass — enter a false birthdate claiming to be 18+. No verification at account creation.

circumventionMethods.method: Mimic adult behavior to pass behavioral model
circumventionMethods.timeToBypass: Variable — days to weeks of normal-seeming activity
circumventionMethods.details: A tech-savvy teen who knows the platform uses behavioral signals can deliberately use adult-pattern vocabulary and topics to avoid triggering the underage flag.

circumventionMethods.method: Use parent/older sibling selfie for Persona verification
circumventionMethods.timeToBypass: < 5 minutes if a willing adult is available
circumventionMethods.details: Persona's facial age estimation verifies that the person in the selfie appears 18+. A teen could use a sibling or parent's face for the selfie.

circumventionMethods.method: Create new account with false information
circumventionMethods.details: If flagged on existing account, create a new email address and new Character.ai account claiming to be an adult.

dataCollection.retention: Retained until account deletion; no stated maximum
dataCollection.details: All messages sent to AI characters are stored. Character.ai staff, contractors, and service providers may access conversations for safety, quality, and operational purposes. No end-to-end encryption.
Email address, username, date of birth, account creation date, authentication method (email/Google/Apple SSO).
Time on platform, characters interacted with, session frequency and duration, features used.
Device identifiers, IP address, browser type, operating system, geographic region (for content localization and age assurance signals).

dataCollection.retention: Processed for voice features; retention not separately specified
dataCollection.details: Voice input captured when using voice chat features. May be processed by third-party speech services.

dataCollection.retention: As long as shared in conversations
dataCollection.details: Images and media shared within conversations are collected per the August 2025 privacy policy update.

dataCollection.retention: Persona biometric data retained per Persona's policy (minimal)
dataCollection.details: Persona biometric/selfie data retained only as long as needed for age verification, per Persona's privacy controls.

modelTraining.details: Conversations are used to train and improve Character.ai's language models. No public opt-out mechanism documented as of research date. Deleting your account is the only way to prevent future data use.
No separate policy for teen data regarding model training. Same terms as adult users applied.
Stories interactions may be used for model training. No distinct minor data training opt-out policy published.

regulatoryActions.details: FTC issued Section 6(b) orders to Character Technologies on September 11, 2025, as part of an investigation into seven AI chatbot companies. Investigation focuses on: evaluation of chatbot safety, steps taken to limit harm to children and teens, and disclosure of risks to users and parents.

regulatoryActions.status: Multiple active lawsuits, one partial settlement
regulatoryActions.details: 10+ active lawsuits alleging platform contributed to teen suicides (Setzer, Peralta, Texas teen case, Raine) and sexual exploitation of minors. Federal judge ruled in January 2025 the Setzer lawsuit can proceed on First Amendment rejection. Google and Character.AI agreed to settle some related lawsuits in January 2026 (terms undisclosed).
Character.ai's terms bar EU users under 16 (above the general 13 minimum) in acknowledgment of GDPR requirements. No formal EU regulatory action documented as of research date.

memoryFeatures.details: Characters remember everything said within an active conversation session. This is automatic and cannot be disabled. Creates emotional continuity within a session.
Some characters have limited persistent memory features that recall elements from previous conversations. This feature varies by character and platform implementation.

Users can browse their full conversation history. Individual conversations can be deleted by users, though no bulk history clear option is documented. Platform retains deleted conversations per its privacy policy retention schedule.
